Commercial Agency Kongo Free State Boma-Kampa. Lomani River April 17th, 1893
To the Honorable Assistant Secretary of State Washington, D.C.
Sir" I have the honor to report any ar- rival att Boma-Kamba April 10th + that on the 14th forming the expedition against the Arab Slave dealers. As I resired greatly to see the part of the Kongo Free State reoccupied key the arabs it being con- sidered the richest and most purposelly and as it was impossible to visit this section unless with a strong expe- dition commandant Chalting invited me to go with with as a quest and as stated in any letter of March 17th (no member) I accepted upon arrival at Bena-Kamba behold one three of his officers Under the peculiar circumstances I accepted the proposition and am commanding hid two Krupp Field csnon and one armed soldiers of course it is quite understood that phase or accept any remmaration from the Kongo Free State.
This Lomani River was opened last year in the month of march by the Dyndicat du Katanga" of Brussels with Mr.R.Hodester at its head. They
established

established. Trading Stahons, or Facloyo at the following profits Yanga. Bena-Kamba + Lomo in the Lomama and at Kibongo Riba: Ruba and Nygangous in the High Kongo, or Loulaba River after these places were founded and stocked with goods to the value of over $250,00.00 the Arabs attacked them, killing the agents of Loma +Riba. Riba + Mr.Hodister with four white companing on the was from Bema Kemba to Riba Ribe the other agents at the different factories heard this and made their escape to Stanley falls. The State agent at Riba Riba was tortured to death. All the factories were burned and the cloths, beads, money, etc taken.
This January they have killed the two State Agents ar Kassonho so the govern- ment organized me expedition from Lusamno in the Lankuru River to pro- ceed a gainst Nyangone+Kassongo+ one to go from Basoko to the Lomami +destroy Chari. Beng Kamba + Riba- Riba +Kibonge. The situation now stands:--
Liutenant Dhanis form Lusambo, occupies Nyangone + is marching to Kassongo with four hundred poldew and on any hundreds of natives who have voluntarily joined his Captain Chaltier has destroyed Chari a town of 1000 houses and a population estimated at 15000 persons and on the 20th instant starts for Riba-Riba with four hundred soldiers +expects to be re-enforced by the natives on the road.
In the River Lomani me have been in many villages destroyed nu the Arabs in their slave
raids <pb facs="20170614_143931"
was, and in two places the headless bodies men, women, and children were found . These people are simply devasting centrak Africa, buit I think the energetie measures the Government are now taking will put a slop to this refarious half life at least for a long time, in the secretary of the state.
At the present I can only give the present survey to this slave business, but in my final report will dwell upon it to a greater extent:
I am Sir, Very respectfully R.Dorsey Mohew Commercial Agent
